a gentle guide

A guess a good start are the two movies ..

Snakes and Rubies which is a good intro to the concepts behind Django (and Rails is you watch the whole thing).

Django – Google talk repeats some stuff but also takes things further and is probably something to come back to once you know a little more.

For reading..

Django for non-programmers is a great start.

Jeff’s also done a great series on Templates ..

Templates – an introduction

Template inheritance (wish Rails had this!)

The official documentation is also good, with a four part tutorial and a guide for template authors

NB when googling around watch out for older articles on Django, the framework has changed significantly recently. Removing the Magic is an attempt to stabilize the API, and some old stuff still uses pre-magicRemoval code.

I’ve just noticed that the source code for the djangoproject website is now updated to ‘post-mr’, starting here
